title: Historians on the effects of New Deal

content.question: Using the excerpts, respond to parts a, b, and c. Briefly describe one major difference between Leuchtenburg’s and Biles’ historical interpretations of the New Deal. Briefly explain how one specific historical event, development, or circumstance from 1932 to 1940 that is not explicitly mentioned in the excerpts could be used to support Leuchtenburg’s argument. Briefly explain how one specific historical event, development, or circumstance from 1932 to 1940 that is not explicitly mentioned in the excerpts could be used to support Biles’ argument.

frqParts.text: Using the excerpts, respond to parts a, b, and c. Briefly describe one major difference between Leuchtenburg’s and Biles’ historical interpretations of the New Deal. Briefly explain how one specific historical event, development, or circumstance from 1932 to 1940 that is not explicitly mentioned in the excerpts could be used to support Leuchtenburg’s argument. Briefly explain how one specific historical event, development, or circumstance from 1932 to 1940 that is not explicitly mentioned in the excerpts could be used to support Biles’ argument.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Compare the arguments or main ideas of two sources.
